citation.article-title: An indigo-reducing moderate thermophile from a woad vat, Clostridium isatidis sp. nov.

p.s: Description of Clostridium isatidis sp. nov.
Clostridium isatidis (i.sa'ti.dis. Gr. gen. n. isatidis of the crucifer plant Isatis)
Colonies are creamy white, mucoid, circular to irregular and low convex or raised to a central point.
Cells are rod-shaped (0.3-0.6 μm by 1.8-9-1 μm) and occur singly, in pairs or in chains.
The temperature range for growth is 30-55 °C, with an optimum temperature of 49-52 °C.
The pH range is initial pH 5.6-9.9 with an optimum pH 7.2 ± 0.2 (in controlled-batch culture).
At 50 °C and pH 7.2 ± 0.2, the doubling time is 26 min (μ, 1.6h-1).
Acid is produced from amygdalin, cellobiose, fructose, galactose, glucose, maltose, mannose, salicin, sorbitol, sucrose, starch and trehalose.
Acetic, lactic and formic acids, ethanol, carbon dioxide and hydrogen are produced during growth on PYG.
The G + C content of strain Wv6T is 27 mol %.
